How does Verus's multi-currency fractional reserve system work, and what are some key features and benefits of using it on the Verus Testnet?

Verus's multi-currency fractional reserve system is a UTXO-based system that allows for the creation of fractional reserve currencies with anti-front running and a provably fair liquidity system. This system is designed to facilitate the creation and management of multiple currencies and tokens within the Verus ecosystem.

On the Verus Testnet, this system is enhanced with new multi-currency parameters that allow for more complex transactions and conversions. For example, the "sendcurrency" API allows users to specify the source currency of a transaction, as well as the currency to which they want to convert. This enables users to convert between different currencies, including fractional currencies, with ease.

One key benefit of this system is its ability to provide a high degree of liquidity and flexibility in currency transactions. By allowing users to create and manage multiple currencies, the system enables a wide range of use cases, from simple currency transactions to more complex financial instruments.

Another benefit of the Verus multi-currency fractional reserve system is its anti-front running feature. This feature prevents malicious actors from manipulating the system by front-running transactions, ensuring that all transactions are executed fairly and transparently.

Overall, the Verus multi-currency fractional reserve system is a powerful tool that enables users to create and manage complex financial instruments and transactions with ease. Its features and benefits make it an attractive option for those looking to build and deploy decentralized financial applications on the Verus platform.

## New in v0.7.1-5
This non-mandatory release is compatible with mainnet with mininal changes from v0.7.1-1. It contains fixes necessary to continue participating in the testnet launched in v0.7.1-1, without reset of your wallet or holdings, if you started using the VRSCTEST multi-currency testnet in v0.7.1-1 or later. You should be able to synchronize easily, but if you are unable to synchronize VRSCTEST shortly after connecting, try deleting the data in your VRSCTEST folder, and retain the wallet.dat file.# Verus Testnet with Multi-currency Fractional Reserves and Currency Launch Protocol
Verus multi-currency fractional reserve baskets are UTXO-based, fractional reserve currencies with anti-front running, simultaneously solved, provably fair liquidity system for all currencies and tokens in or imported into the PBaaS system.While Verus daemon v0.7.1-5 has no improvements for mainnet operation, it offers full support for the new Verus Testnet multi-currency technology preview. On testnet, the new "sendcurrency" API, which is already available on Verus mainnet in its simplified form, is enhanced with new multi-currency parameters. The first parameter, "currency":"currencyname" - where the default on testnet for currency name is "vrsctest", specifies the source currency of the send. The next, "convertto":"currencyname", allows conversion from one currency to either a fractional currency where it is a reserve or a reserve of the fractional currency of the source.
